attribute.name: Unknown
attribute.description: No informations for this attribute.

attribute.name: Read Error Rate
attribute.description: Stores data related to the rate of hardware read errors that occurred when reading data from a disk surface. The raw value has different structure for different vendors and is often not meaningful as a decimal number.

attribute.name: Throughput Performance
attribute.description: Overall (general) throughput performance of a hard disk drive. If the value of this attribute is decreasing there is a high probability that there is a problem with the disk.

attribute.name: Spin-Up Time
attribute.description: Average time of spindle spin up (from zero RPM to fully operational, measured in millisecs).

attribute.name: Start/Stop Count
attribute.description: A tally of spindle start/stop cycles. The spindle turns on, and hence the count is increased, both when the hard disk is turned on after having before been turned entirely off (disconnected from power source) and when the hard disk returns from having previously been put to sleep mode.

attribute.name: Reallocated Sectors Count
attribute.description: Count of reallocated sectors. When the hard drive finds a read/write/verification error, it marks that sector as "reallocated" and transfers data to a special reserved area (spare area). This process is also known as remapping, and reallocated sectors are called "remaps". The raw value normally represents a count of the bad sectors that have been found and remapped.

attribute.name: Read Channel Margin
attribute.description: Margin of a channel while reading data. The function of this attribute is not specified.

attribute.name: Seek Error Rate
attribute.description: Rate of seek errors of the magnetic heads. If there is a partial failure in the mechanical positioning system, then seek errors will arise. Such a failure may be due to numerous factors, such as damage to a servo, or thermal widening of the hard disk. The raw value has different structure for different vendors and is often not meaningful as a decimal number.

attribute.name: Seek Time Performance
attribute.description: Average performance of seek operations of the magnetic heads. If this attribute is decreasing, it is a sign of problems in the mechanical subsystem.

attribute.name: Power-On Hours
attribute.description: Count of hours in power-on state. The raw value of this attribute shows total count of hours in power-on state.

attribute.name: Power-On Minutes
attribute.description: Count of minutes in power-on state. The raw value of this attribute shows total count of minutes in power-on state.

attribute.name: Spin Retry Count
attribute.description: Count of retry of spin start attempts. This attribute stores a total count of the spin start attempts to reach the fully operational speed (under the condition that the first attempt was unsuccessful). An increase of this attribute value is a sign of problems in the hard disk mechanical subsystem.

attribute.name: Calibration Retry Count
attribute.description: This attribute indicates the count that recalibration was requested (under the condition that the first attempt was unsuccessful). An increase of this attribute value is a sign of problems in the hard disk mechanical subsystem.

attribute.name: Power Cycle Count
attribute.description: This attribute indicates the count of full hard disk power on/off cycles.

attribute.name: Soft Read Error Rate
attribute.description: Uncorrected read errors reported to the operating system.

attribute.name: SATA Downshift Error Count
attribute.description: Western Digital and Samsung attribute.

attribute.name: End-to-End error
attribute.description: This attribute is a part of HP's SMART IV technology and it means that after transferring through the cache RAM data buffer the parity data between the host and the hard drive did not match.

attribute.name: Head Stability
attribute.description: Western Digital attribute.

attribute.name: Induced Op-Vibration Detection
attribute.description: Western Digital attribute.

attribute.name: Reported Uncorrectable Errors
attribute.description: The count of errors that could not be recovered using hardware ECC.

attribute.name: Command Timeout
attribute.description: The count of aborted operations due to HDD timeout. Normally this attribute value should be equal to zero and if the value is far above zero, then most likely there will be some serious problems with power supply or an oxidized data cable.

attribute.name: High Fly Writes
attribute.description: HDD producers implement a Fly Height Monitor that attempts to provide additional protections for write operations by detecting when a recording head is flying outside its normal operating range. If an unsafe fly height condition is encountered, the write process is stopped, and the information is rewritten or reallocated to a safe region of the hard drive. This attribute indicates the count of these errors detected over the lifetime of the drive.

attribute.name: Airflow Temperature
attribute.description: Airflow temperature on Western Digital HDs.

attribute.name: G-sense error rate
attribute.description: The count of errors resulting from externally-induced shock and vibration.

attribute.name: Power-off Retract Count
attribute.description: Count of times the heads are loaded off the media. Heads can be unloaded without actually powering off.

attribute.name: Load Cycle Count
attribute.description: Count of load/unload cycles into head landing zone position.

attribute.name: Temperature
attribute.description: Current internal temperature.

attribute.name: Hardware ECC Recovered
attribute.description: The raw value has different structure for different vendors and is often not meaningful as a decimal number.

attribute.name: Reallocation Event Count
attribute.description: Count of remap operations. The raw value of this attribute shows the total count of attempts to transfer data from reallocated sectors to a spare area. Both successful and unsuccessful attempts are counted.

attribute.name: Current Pending Sector Count
attribute.description: Count of "unstable" sectors (waiting to be remapped, because of read errors). If an unstable sector is subsequently read successfully, this value is decreased and the sector is not remapped.

attribute.name: Uncorrectable Sector Count
attribute.description: The total count of uncorrectable errors when reading/writing a sector. A rise in the value of this attribute indicates defects of the disk surface and/or problems in the mechanical subsystem.

attribute.name: UltraDMA CRC Error Count
attribute.description: The count of errors in data transfer via the interface cable as determined by ICRC (Interface Cyclic Redundancy Check).

attribute.name: Multi-Zone Error Rate
attribute.description: The count of errors found when writing a sector. The higher the value, the worse the disk's mechanical condition is.

attribute.name: Write Error Rate
attribute.description: The total count of errors when writing a sector.

attribute.name: Soft Read Error Rate
attribute.description: Count of off-track errors.

attribute.name: Data Address Mark errors
attribute.description: Count of Data Address Mark errors.

attribute.name: Run Out Cancel
attribute.description: Count of ECC errors.

attribute.name: Soft ECC Correction
attribute.description: Count of errors corrected by software ECC.

attribute.name: Thermal Asperity Rate
attribute.description: Count of errors due to high temperature.

attribute.name: Flying Height
attribute.description: Height of heads above the disk surface. A flying height that's too low increases the chances of a head crash while a flying height that's too high increases the chances of a read/write error.

attribute.name: Spin High Current
attribute.description: Amount of surge current used to spin up the drive.

attribute.name: Spin Buzz
attribute.description: Count of buzz routines needed to spin up the drive due to insufficient power.

attribute.name: Offline Seek Performance
attribute.description: Drive’s seek performance during its internal tests.

attribute.name: Vibration During Write
attribute.description: Vibration During Write.

attribute.name: Shock During Write
attribute.description: Shock During Write.

attribute.name: Disk Shift
attribute.description: Distance the disk has shifted relative to the spindle (usually due to shock or temperature). Unit of measure is unknown.

attribute.name: G-Sense Error Rate
attribute.description: The count of errors resulting from externally-induced shock and vibration.

attribute.name: Loaded Hours
attribute.description: Time spent operating under data load (movement of magnetic head armature).

attribute.name: Load/Unload Retry Count
attribute.description: Count of times head changes position.

attribute.name: Load Friction
attribute.description: Resistance caused by friction in mechanical parts while operating.

attribute.name: Load/Unload Cycle Count
attribute.description: Total count of load cycles.

attribute.name: Load 'In'-time
attribute.description: Total time of loading on the magnetic heads actuator (time not spent in parking area).

attribute.name: Torque Amplification Count
attribute.description: Count of attempts to compensate for platter speed variations.

attribute.name: Power-Off Retract Cycle
attribute.description: The count of times the magnetic armature was retracted automatically as a result of cutting power.

attribute.name: GMR Head Amplitude
attribute.description: Amplitude of "thrashing" (distance of repetitive forward/reverse head motion).

attribute.name: Temperature
attribute.description: Drive Temperature.

attribute.name: Endurance Remaining
attribute.description: Number of physical erase cycles completed on the drive as a percentage of the maximum physical erase cycles the drive supports.

attribute.name: Available Reserved Space
attribute.description: Intel SSD reports the number of available reseved space as a percentage of reseved space in a brand new SSD.

attribute.name: Power-On Hours
attribute.description: Number of hours elapsed in the power-on state.

attribute.name: Media Wearout Indicator
attribute.description: Intel SSD reports a normalized value of 100 (when the SSD is new) and declines to a minimum value of 1. It decreases while the NAND erase cycles increase from 0 to the maximum-rated cycles.

attribute.name: Head Flying Hours
attribute.description: Time while head is positioning.

attribute.name: Transfer Error Rate
attribute.description: Count of times the link is reset during a data transfer.

attribute.name: Total LBAs Written
attribute.description: Total count of LBAs written.

attribute.name: Total LBAs Read
attribute.description: Total count of LBAs read.

attribute.name: Read Error Retry Rate
attribute.description: Count of errors while reading from a disk.

attribute.name: Free Fall Protection
attribute.description: Count of "Free Fall Events" detected.
